{{cpp/container/inplace_vector/title|push_back}}
{{cpp/container/inplace_vector/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++26|
constexpr reference push_back( const T&amp; value );
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++26|
constexpr reference push_back( T&amp;&amp; value );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Appends the given element {{c|value}} to the end of the container.

@1@ The new element is initialized as a copy of {{c|value}}.
@2@ {{c|value}} is moved into the new element.

{{cpp/container/note iterator invalidation|inplace_vector|push_back}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|value|the value of the element to append}}
{{par hreq}}
{{par req named|T|CopyInsertable|overload=1}}
{{par req named|T|MoveInsertable|overload=2}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{rlpf|back}}, i.e. a reference to the inserted element.

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Exceptions===
* {{lc|std::bad_alloc}} if {{c|1=size() == capacity()}} before invocation.
* Any exception thrown by initialization of inserted element.
{{cpp/strong exception safety guarantee|plural=yes}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;inplace_vector&gt;
#include &lt;new&gt;
#include &lt;print&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::inplace_vector&lt;std::string, 2&gt; fauna;
    std::string dog{"\N{DOG}"};

    fauna.push_back("\N{CAT}"); // overload (1)
    fauna.push_back(std::move(dog)); // overload (2)
    std::println("fauna = {}", fauna);

    try
    {
        fauna.push_back("\N{BUG}"); // throws: there is no space
    }
    catch(const std::bad_alloc&amp; ex)
    {
        std::println("{}", ex.what());
    }
    std::println("fauna = {}", fauna);
}
|p=true
|output=
fauna = ["üêà", "üêï"]
std::bad_alloc
fauna = ["üêà", "üêï"]
}}
